fields.description:
If the URL got two issue keys in the text field, for example: http://localhost:8080/browse/TST-1/docs/TST-1 (see screenshot: URL_in_text_field_(edit_screen).png)
then it will be rendered wrongly in the browse issue screen such as: TST-1">http://localhost:8080/browse/TST-1/docs/TST-1 (see screenshot: URL_in_text_field_(browse_issue_screen).png)
This bug has been tested to appear in JIRA 3.13, 3.13.1 and 3.13.2 for Firefox and IE browser. It is fixed in JIRA 3.13.3 (see screenshot: URL_in_text_field_(browse_issue_screen)-fixed.png)
fields.summary: URL rendered wrongly if got two issue keys

fields.description:
The top menu in JIRA 4.0 application is not translated. 

I see the translation file contains the keys as well as translations:

{code}
# shared top nav bar
alt.text.username = <u>N</u>azwa U\u017cytkownika
alt.text.username.accessKey = n
alt.text.password = <u>H</u>as\u0142o
alt.text.password.accessKey = h
alt.text.rememberlogin = <u>P</u>ami\u0119taj mnie na tym komputerze
alt.text.rememberlogin.accessKey = p
alt.text.home = <u>S</u>tart
alt.text.home.accessKey = s
alt.text.browseproject = Prz<u>e</u>gl\u0105daj Projekty
alt.text.browseproject.accessKey = e
alt.text.findissues = <u>Z</u>najd\u017a Zadania
alt.text.findissues.accessKey = z
alt.text.createnewissue = <u>U</u>tw\u00f3rz Nowe Zadanie
alt.text.createnewissue.accessKey = u
alt.text.admin = <u>A</u>dministracja
alt.text.admin.accessKey = a
alt.text.quicksearch = Szybkie <u>W</u>yszukiwanie
alt.text.quicksearch.accessKey = w
alt.text.quicksearch.title = Id\u017a bezpo\u015brednio do zadania wprowadzaj\u0105c prawid\u0142owe ID zadania lub uruchamiaj\u0105c wyszukiwanie tekstowe.
{code}

But the main bar is still untranslated.
fields.summary: Polish top menu translation

fields.description:
When I use the Filter Results Gadget and am yet to click the magic padlock, I am given the following error message:

{quote}
There are problems with the current configuration for this gadget. The errors below may have been caused by the deletion of entities required by the gadget or by changes to your permissions.

    * Invalid filter
{quote}

It doesn't mention anything about the vague possibility that I may just need to log in.  I'm not sure how most users figure this out.

h4. Related issues
* [JRA-21656] another issue about the same error message in the same gadget.
* [JRA-19784] a different misleading error message
fields.summary: Filter Results Gadget: Misleading error message reported when authentication required

fields.description:
* Create a filter in JAC which is shared with all users
* Confirm that as an anonymous user in JAC, you can view the filter
* Add a page to EAC, and use the filter gadget to show the JAC filter just added

The gadget will show errors for the fields which are not visible to anon users:

!JIRA-filter.jpg!


See example at: https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/~mhrynczak/2010/08/19/3.4-m3+issues+found+on+QA-EAC

The gadget displays as expected to authenticated users.
fields.summary: JIRA Filter Gadget does not work correctly for anonymous users
Bulk attachment Delete or Download

fields.description:
Is it possible to get the latest 6.0 tomcat bundled with the official 4.2 release?
There have been a few security issues addressed since the 6.0.20 tomcat (the version currently bundled with the 4.2 beta 1 Standalone JIRA)
see https://tomcat.apache.org/security-6.html
fields.summary: Upgrade tomcat app server for standalone to tomcat 6.0.32

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-22177].
  {panel}

When building project key patterns, custom patterns should be wrapped in parentheses.

See class DefaultKeyMatcher constructor.

See support issue https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-63357

In essence, subtle pattern match problems can arise, if the JIRA administrator provides a pattern which has alternates.

Assume for the moment that the administrator provides this simple key pattern: 

   ALPHA|BETA

Then, the project key regular pattern will be constructed as

   /^ALPHA|BETA$/

Which will match any of the following

   ALPHA
   ALPHA-DOG
   BETA
   5BETA
   %^&^&**()BETA

Does this make sense?

The proper pattern should be:

   /^(ALPHA|BETA)$/

Since I'm unfamiliar with the Perl5Util classes, I can only ask why the need to enclose the entire pattern in stroke characters.  From my knowledge of Perl, the stroke characters are part of the syntax used to indicate that there is a pattern, and they are not maintained as part of the pattern.
fields.summary: Add Guarding Parentheses in DefaultKeyMatcher class

fields.description:
The current init script located here:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Starting+JIRA+Standalone+automatically+on+Linux

Does not handle an unclean shutdown. 
Ideally:
* The startup sequence would check if Tomcat is currently running and if it isn't remove the JIRA home lock file if present

* The shutdown sequence would have a dynamic timeout instead of the default static timeout
fields.summary: Improve JIRA Linux init script

fields.description:
In my setup, I do have a "robot user" who is used by the 'create or comment' e-mail handler. 

As the reporter, this user always gets e-mails when anything happens to the tickets, which unnecessary  fills my inbox.

I want this user to be able to say "I don't want to receive any e-mail notifications" to stop the reception of those e-mails.

Support staff also suggested using cusomt notification schemes, but since in this projects there are also humans who want that notifications, this doesn't work.

Another use case would be a user who really wants to be cut out of communication but keep his / her account "for future use (tm)".

I'd suggest putting this setting into the "profile" page, next to where I define whether I want to be notified about my own changes (see the 'beautiful' mockup i attached)
fields.summary: Add the ability for a user to opt out of all e-mail configuration

fields.description:
Below is the story:
Currently if I send an e-mail from Jira to multiple people, and do not include my own private/outlook e-mail address in the list, if someone does reply-all to the e-mail, I do not get a copy in my private/outlook e-mail system. I have to remember to go look at the jira item to see if anyone has replied.

My little suggestions:
1. I have checked "JIRA Email This Issue Plugin":
https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/wiki/display/JETI/JIRA+Email+This+Issue+Plugin
There is a Feature of this plugin: "8.you have options like "CC to me" and "Reply to me" to receive a copy of the email or to receive replies to the email." While I can't find "CC to me" on the "Email options" tag. There is only "Reply to me". Please refer to attachment image named "emailOptions.png".

2. I also find "Send copy to :" checkboxes on the "Email This Issue" tag, please refer to attachment image named "sendCopyTo.png". So if there is really no such "CC to me" checkbox on our "Email options" tag, could you default check "Send copy to: me"?
fields.summary: E-mails sent from Jira should auto-copy to sender's e-mail address

fields.description:
The problem is that when you first hit /auth you get a new session...but nothing ever puts a user in it.

Then when come around again to go to /issue Seraph sees that you have a session but finds no user in it...then it doesn't bother to look at the cookie. Seraph should probably be looking at the cookie in this case rather than the session. (But we do it in that order because we optimise for the common case.)

jira-rest-plugin's problem is that using LoginService doesn't do all the same stuff that the DefaultAuthenticator does. We need to switch to the DA (or something similar).
fields.summary: using JSESSIONID from /auth REST resource doesn't work

Also a lot of the users deeply miss the side toolbar in the ticket view that was available in the previous versions.

fields.description:
Dashboard page is never getting expired (session timeout), even with all the gadgets set with "Refresh Interval" set to "never". Other pages get timed out fine. This was reported by a customer and I was able to reproduce in my environment as well.

The session timeout was configured to 30m in the web.xml file.
fields.summary: Dashboard page is never getting expired (session timeout)

fields.description:
JIRA permits the creation of groups with empty names.

How to reproduce:
# Click on "Group Browser"
# Just click "Add Group" leaving the field blank.

\\And worst, you cannot delete that group anymore.

*Workaround:*

*Please, create a database backup before manually changing it!*

Delete the group manually in database.
{code}
DELETE FROM groupbase WHERE groupname LIKE ''
{code}
_JIRA needs to be restarted in order to apply this change._
fields.summary: JIRA permits the creation of groups with empty names

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-22163].
  {panel}

Today Atlassian recommends character set encoding UTF8 for Oracle database. 
But Oracle recommends that if the environment (clients and servers) consists entirely of Oracle 9i or higher, use AL32UTF8 as NLS_CHARACTERSET, otherwise use UTF8.
As far as I know, the AL32UTF8 is equivalent to the standard UTF-8. The difference is that AL32UTF8 is more appropriate for XML data.
I would be great if someone could test compatibility between JIRA and this character set encoding, and if it's not, make it compatible.

Please let me know if you need further explanation.

Regards,
____________________
Felipe Kraemer
Atlassian Support
fields.summary: AL32UTF8 Character Encoding Compatibility

fields.summary: JIRA labels lozenge is hard to read

fields.description:
Basically when you edit a custom field you invalidate all cached field configuration. This means that it has to be read from the DB again and re-cached. Unfortunately, JIRA will read the configuration for each field individually which can lead to many (thousands) of SQL queries and slow page loads for people using JIRA after the configuration change.

For example. I have and instance with 558 custom fields and 771 field configurations. If I edit the description of any custom field these are the >2500 queries (you may need to scroll to see the query count column) that JIRA runs to just show the custom field list. 

!change_description_313.png!

If I then goto the issue navigator I run the following queries.

!view_navigator_313.png!

This time well over 3000 queries are run (again you may need to scroll to the right to see the column). If I then re-load the issue navigator then no SQL queries are run because things are now cached.

This number of queries can cause significant delays even on very fast database servers. Some pages can take 5-10 seconds to load after a field configuration change. This causes significant pain to users who change their field configuration regularly.

Maybe JIRA should be eagerly loading the cache  (i.e. all the configuration for all the fields in a single query) rather than lazy loading it (i.e. lots of queries per field configuration) as the configuration will be used in most operations in JIRA. 

This problem does not appear to be fixed in 4.1 (maybe it got worse). Check out the ~2000 SQL queries executed to view the "Custom Field Page" after changing a field description.

!change_description_41.png!

Further, notice the the ~4000 queries executed when viewing the issue navigator for the first time after the description change.

!view_navigator_41.png! 

Again if you then view the navigator again no queries are run as all the information is cached.
fields.summary: JIRA Performance degrades significantly for a short time after editing any custom field if you have a lot of custom fields
Use of code macro in comment block formats incorrectly

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-22154].
  {panel}

When you move an issue on JIRA, the key automatically redirects to the new location.  Say
http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-123
was moved to
http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GOOGLE-5

If you try to load the first link, with JRA-123, it will automatically go to GOOGLE-5.  However, when using the SOAP API, it no longer works.  An error is thrown saying the issue JRA-123 does not exist.

It would be great to have this feature implemented. Thank you.
fields.summary: SOAP API does not work for Moved issues
Filter Issues and all it's subtasks

fields.description:
In a jira plugin, I am trying to make a web-item which defines  a link element to a non http absolute url.
Setting the attribute absolute to true is not taking effect. The uri define in the link is set at the end of the server url.


For exemple:
<web-item key="test" i18n-name-key="web.item.test" name="test" section="operations-work" weight="9">
                <label key="web.item.test"/>
                <tooltip key="web.item.test"/>
                <link linkId="test" absolute="true">ftp://test</link>
</web-item>


When clicking the web-item, we excpect the ftp://test url to be opened.
Instead of that, Jira tries to open the following url: http://localhost:2990/jiraftp://test
fields.summary: Web Item Link Elements: absolute attribute does not work

fields.description:
Precondition:
An issue type  IT-A has a sub-issue type SIT-B with a screen SIT-B-Screen (having custom fields) assigned.

Action:
A second sub-issue type SIT-C with a screen SIT-C-Screen (having same custom fields as SIT-B-Screen and other custom fields) ,  is assigned to IT-A, ....

Bug:
... then not all fields of SIT-C-Screen are shown when creating the the SIT-C. It looks like only the new custom fields and some default fields are shown on SIT-C-Screen but not the custom fields already on SIT-B-Screen.
fields.summary: Second Sub Issue Type Screen does not show all assign Field

fields.description:
[Building JIRA from Source |http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Building+JIRA+from+Source].

Trustedapps package is not available as part of the source download. It seems to be located at
https://studio.atlassian.com/source/browse/TRUST for which I dont have access (Registered at studio.atlassian.com).

It might be helpful if you can mention in the wiki what is opensourced and whats not as well as a location to download the opensource bits (for e.g. seraph).
fields.summary: Building JIRA from Source page should stated open sourced and close sourced packages

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-22148].
  {panel}

When I went to authorise a JAC gadget on Extranet, I was redirected to the following URL:

http://jira.atlassian.com/plugins/servlet/oauth/authorize?oauth_callback=http%3A%2F%2Foauth.gmodules.com%2Fgadgets%2Foauthcallback&oauth_token=4zXLpR7MPgMlK8RR7IRjp36MWnDBRvso

This comes back as text in the browser. See the attached file for the source. The page content is:

bq. The request token you are trying to authorize is not valid. Please try another token.

I'm currently logged into JAC, with remember-me active. The response headers are as follows:

{noformat}
Date: Mon, 30 Aug 2010 05:30:20 GMT
Server: Apache-Coyote/1.1
WWW-Authenticate: OAuth realm="http%3A%2F%2Fjira.atlassian.com" OAuth realm="http%3A%2F%2Fjira.atlassian.com", oauth_problem="token_rejected"
Content-Length: 3560
Connection: close
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8
{noformat}

The content-type here should be set to text/html, not text/plain.
fields.summary: OAuth token out-of-date screen not served as text/html

fields.description:
We are changing the preview icons so they are below the fields now rather than next to them?

!http://img.skitch.com/20100830-crhnued714n7ytrixmyi3n6t19.jpg!

This is really very awkward and it feels somewhat disconnected from the actual field. It looks like it has something to do with the field description, not the input.  


Current versions of JIRA and Crucible put it to the right:

!http://img.skitch.com/20100830-e488uundkt2jsps4t2k9qararm.jpg! 

Here you know its definitely attached to the input field, not the description.
fields.summary: Location change of preview icon is awkward
Expand comment field to fill screen

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce this behaviour:

# Paste (Ctrl+V) text that exceeds number of blank lines displayed in custom field or Comment.
# Field gets expanded and the scrollbar appears, but the field still displays the beginning of the content, rather than the cursor position line. 

On any following cursor move the field scrolls down to the cursor location.
fields.summary: Multi line custom fields on paste don't scroll down to cursor position

fields.description:
In order to reproduce this behaviour paste with the 3rd mouse key text consisting more lines than number of empty lines visible in the field. 

Field will display only the lines that fit into the visible empty lines and any additional lines will overflow out of the visible part of the field.

!3rd_key_paste.png!

The field gets expanded on the next cursor move. 

!3rd_key_paste_expanded.png!
fields.summary: Comment field doesn't expand on paste with 3rd key on linux

fields.description:
we have a Workflow Post Function which is closing all linked issues to the current issue when the current issue gets closed! previously we used workflowTransitionUtil to execute this task but we are in the process to migrate to the IssueService.


with the workflowTransitionUtil we got an validation error message if we tried to close an open issue (without an resolution set) that a resolution is required.

if we try exactly the same transition (jira default transition id=2, close issue) with the new IssueService.transition... the step will be executed!

if I have a look at the issue after the transition, the issue is in the status=closed and resolution=unresolved!

if I a dig a bit into the implementation of workflowTransitionUtil it shows that the Resolution Field is handled specially and is always required... but not in the case of the IssueService!
fields.summary: inconsistant behaviour between issueService.transition and workflowTransitionUtil when processing jira default transition id=2 (Close Issue)

fields.description:
In order to reproduce this behaviour:

   1. enter 5 lines of text into the Hover over Comment field,
   2. hit Enter,
   3. enter 6th line (you experience variation of [JRA-22141|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-22141]
   4. hit Enter in order to type the 7th line
_Observed :_ content of the 7th line isn't displayed until you navigate between lines or enter some more text into the 7th line.

!6th_line.png!

expanded 7th line:

!7th_line.png!

_Expected :_ field will expand to display the 6th line correctly.
fields.summary: Hover over Comment field doesn't expand on 6th line

fields.description:
In order to reproduce this behaviour:
# enter 8 lines of text into the lower Comment field,
# hit Enter,
# start typing content of the 9th line
_Observed :_ content of the line is being  displayed partially.

!9th_line.png!

_Expected :_ field will expand to display the 9th line correctly.

In the same time, the 10th and any next line will expand the field correctly.
!10th_line.png!
fields.summary: Content of 9th line displayed partially in Comment field

fields.description:
The change in behaviour is observed between 4.1.1 and 4.2-beta1.

In 4.1.1 as you type the  hover over Comment field gets expanded up to 22 lines of text. On the 23rd line the side scrollbar is being displayed.

!comment_4.1.1.png|thumbnail!

In compare to 4.2b1 only 5 lines of text is displayed before the scrollbar appears.

!comment_4.2b.png|thumbnail!

For users who enter significant amount of text it is a significant change in behaviour. This change makes comment editing/review process annoying as you have to use the scrollbar to scroll through the entered text.
fields.summary: Changed behaviour of hover over Comment field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-22139].
  {panel}

Thanks for trying out the new REST api!

With 4.2, we shipped an *alpha* release of our new REST API, which includes mostly read APIs for individual issues.
We continued to evolve the REST API in 4.3 and 4.4.  We published the REST API documentation for 4.3 and 4.4 releases here:

* [JIRA REST API documentation 4.3|http://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/4.3/]
* [JIRA REST API documentation 4.4|http://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/4.4/]

In the JIRA 5.0 release we plan to take the JIRA REST API out of beta.  As always, we would love to hear your feedback and comments about this feature. To keep the discussion centralized (both past and present), feel free to comment on this issue with your feedback.

Please note that the JIRA 5.0 version of the REST API has changed significantly from the alpha and beta API from previous releases.  The JIRA 5.0 API goes well beyond the read-only API from previous versions.  The new REST API should include {{create, update, delete, search}} for Issues and manipulation of individual issue fields.

* [JIRA REST API Tutorial|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+REST+API+%28Alpha%29+Tutorial]
* [JIRA REST API documentation 5.0-m3|http://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/5.0-m3/]
fields.summary: Feedback for REST API
The alternative upgrade method ignores jira.home for index and attachment directories
Right aligned content of "Issues" & "Popularity" columns

fields.description:
One of Jira's strengths is the rich set of plugins available.  I would like to be able to install plugins from the Web App without having to take down the production system or fiddle around with the raw installation files.

This would make it considerably easier to stay up to date with GreenHopper.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-22133].
  {panel}

You can only "Stop Progress" on an issue with status "In Progress" if you are the assignee.
However, you can re-assign the issue to nobody.
At this stage you cannot "Stop Progess".
Best Solution:
You cannot unassign an issue that is "In Progress".
Acceptable Solution:
If the issue is Unassigned, then there is no special restricion on stop progress.
fields.summary: Cannot stop progress on an unassigned Issue

fields.description:
I have 3 queries:

1)  {{reporter = currentUser() and resolution = Unresolved}}  --This yields 98 issues.

2)  {{reporter = currentUser() and resolution = Unresolved and watcher = currentUser()}}  --This yields 34 issues.

1)  {{reporter = currentUser() and resolution = Unresolved and watcher != currentUser()}}  --This yields 3 issues.

61 tickets are unaccounted for (clearly, 34 + 3 does not equal 98.)  Many issues are being missed, and it's hard to tell where.  I think it may be issues where I _and other people_ are watching.  Plural watchers seems to throw off the match.


I used that query because it was a relatively small result set.  The same can be done with only this field (more expensive):

1)  {{ [empty query] }}  --This yields 41,113 issues.

2)  {{watcher = currentUser()}}  --This yields 207 issues.

1)  {{watcher != currentUser()}}  --This yields 4,035 issues.

37,078 tickets are unaccounted for.

The problem can't be one of security level, because then the baseline queries (with the total numbers) should have also been decreased by the number of tickets I cannot view.
fields.summary: JQL: Invalid or incomplete result sets when querying for "watcher" vs. "not watcher"

fields.description:
The wiki markup help feature for Text Effects includes a list of wiki mark up, but none seem to allow a user to add text that requires the formatting to remain unchanged. For example, lines starting with tabs or multiple spaces are consumed and the line then starts with the text rather than maintaining the text in the pasted format. I've tried 
 as per http://www.usemod.com/cgi-bin/wiki.pl?TextFormattingRules#Preformatted_Text and I've tried {pre}{pre}

Could a feature be added to maintain tabs and spaces within {pre} markup tags?
fields.summary: Wiki markup does not seem to support preformatted text

Hi All,

In our wolkflow, when creating an issue, we have two different custom fields which need to be show/hide depent on another customer fields's value.(JIRA doesn't support this type field,so I did some development work by using JavaScript.)Such as,we have a multi-select custom field which value depent on components and a free-text custom field which value depent on a check-box field value. However, it seems JIRA doesn't support that. Any thoughts?

Best Regards,
Niki

fields.description:
Hi Guys,

Let me keep this short, I am having a problem on JIRA Linker plugin func test (latest JIRA 4.2-SNAPSHOT). It is failing with the error below:-

{code}
com.meterware.httpunit.MissingParameterValueException: Parameter 'attachmentPathOption' must have the value 'CUSTOM'. Attempted to set it to: { DEFAULT }
	at com.meterware.httpunit.FormControl.claimValueIsRequired(FormControl.java:279)
	at com.meterware.httpunit.BooleanFormControl.claimRequiredValues(FormControl.java:474)
	at com.meterware.httpunit.RadioGroupFormControl.claimRequiredValues(FormControl.java:587)
	at com.meterware.httpunit.FormParameter.setValues(FormParameter.java:89)
	at com.meterware.httpunit.WebForm.setParameter(WebForm.java:533)
	at net.sourceforge.jwebunit.HttpUnitDialog.updateFormParameter(HttpUnitDialog.java:368)
	at net.sourceforge.jwebunit.WebTester.checkCheckbox(WebTester.java:821)
	at com.atlassian.jira.functest.framework.admin.AttachmentsImpl.enable(AttachmentsImpl.java:28)
	at com.atlassian.jira.webtests.ztests.imports.project.AbstractProjectImportTestCase.importAndExportBackupAndSetupCurrentInstance(AbstractProjectImportTestCase.java:153)
	at com.atlassian.jira.webtests.ztests.imports.project.AbstractProjectImportTestCase.doProjectImport(AbstractProjectImportTestCase.java:80)
	at it.com.atlassian.jira.plugin.linker.TestProjectImportValidation.testImportWithValidUrlAsLinkerCfTypeValue(TestProjectImportValidation.java:15)
{code}

I have check on the [func test library|https://atlaseye.atlassian.com/browse/jira/jira/trunk/subprojects/func_tests/src/test/com/atlassian/jira/functest/framework/admin/AttachmentsImpl.java?r=HEAD] which is check for check box but in JIRA UI it has changed to radio buttons instead. Without this getting fixed, the build in BDAC will keep turning red.

Let me know if there is a need for more information. Thanks!

Regards,
Philip
fields.summary: Problem In Func Test Library
Imrove JQL error handling in simple mode
Typo in error message in AbstractPermissionManager

fields.description: Customer wants the ability to bulk move projects between workflow schemes. When you have a large amount of projects, it's really painful to move manually each project's workflow/workflow scheme.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-22119].
  {panel}

In the Gliffy JIRA Plugin, we enable customers to create diagrams which are attached to JIRA issues.

Our customers would like to be able to include links in their Gliffy diagrams similar to how we do this in Confluence and Gliffy Online.  

In order to make this work in JIRA, we need to be able to back the diagram image with an image map embedded in a web page.  In order for us to do that, we need a plugin hook into how attachments are rendered.

Here is one possible solution:
* When an attachment is saved, specify a renderer for that attachment
* The renderer could be built in one by Atlassian, or a third party plugin
* When an attachment is shown on the Issue screen, how it is displayed is controlled by the renderer (similar to how macros work in confluence).   We would need to be able to control how the attachment is displayed to the user, and we'd need to be able to control contents of the link that is shown to the user

This would enable us to link Gliffy diagram images to a custom Webwork plugin module/page that would display the image in a web page backed by an image map, hence enabling linking of diagrams to other issues, etc.  

Feature request at Gliffy:
http://support.gliffy.com/entries/246556-jira-plugin-support-links-or-relative-links-in-jira-plugin
fields.summary: JIRA Plugin Module(s) to enable more control over attachments on issues

fields.description:
DefaultServiceManager method getServiceWithName does not return the loaded service instance, it returns a new instance of the named service. 

This can easily be replicated by attempting to access the lastRun time of the service returned via this method it will always return 0.

DefaultServiceManager method getServiceWithId correctly returns the loaded service instance.

As a workaround i'm calling getId on the service container returned by getServiceWithName, then using this id with getServiceWithId to return the loaded service container.
fields.summary: DefaultServiceManager method getServiceWithName does not return the loaded service instance

IssueService does not perform checks as the supplied user

fields.description:
Hello,
following the support request JSP-63263 it seems that the issue key is incremented even if the issue creation fails, this may produce big gaps in issue numbering.  I reccomend to increment issue key only when issue creation is succeful. 

How this may happen (according to what experienced in JSP-63263)
-We have jira configured with create or comment mail handler and "forwardTo" correctly set.
-At a point we had the smtp server down during three days, so no outgoing mail from Jira. 
-During these period we have recived (at least) one incoming email producing an error at the issue creation time (related to a mySql DB ecoding issue)
-in this case normally Jira pops the email from the mailbox and sends a "EMAIL HANDLER: Error handling:" notification
-it seems that being impossible to send the notification (smtp down) jira leaves the incoming email in the mailbox and therefore it tries again one minute after to create the issue, incrementing each time the issue key (I suppose this because if you look at the main gap in JSP-63263 (MMSHD-5757 vs. MMSHD-632) you have ( 5757-632=5125 ) / 1440 (minutes per day) = 3.5 days. That is exactly the duration of the smtp sever downtime.)

this is very annoyng because for the final user the impression is that the number of issues has explosed and the system is unstable

I reccomend to increment issue key only when issue creation is succeful.
fields.summary: Jira issue creation increments issue key counter even if creation fails (producing big gap in issue numbering)

fields.description:
According to this bug report (http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-6344), since JIRA 4 when the assignee is changed, a notification is sent to previous and current assignee.

Also, for those people who do not like this new behavior there is a new jira-applications property to revert to the old behavior.

{code}
jira.assignee.change.is.sent.to.both.parties=false
{code}

The problem is that if you need to fire "Issue Assigned" event by a post-function. The notification will ignore the "jira.assignee.change.is.sent.to.both.parties" parameter, i.e, it will always send email to previous and current assignee. The expected behavior would be to send notification respecting the value passed to that parameter.

Although, if you fire a custom event by a post-function, the notification will respect that parameter, i.e., using custom event, it'll work as expected.
fields.summary: Sending notification to previous assignee even setting "jira.assignee.change.is.sent.to.both.parties" to false

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-22100].
  {panel}

This is mostly for enabling easier customization of Jira. Please add an id (id="xxx") to all html elements in Jira that are used when users can create issues.

I have (in various projects) customized Jira to prevent certain issue types from being visible to certain users. In 3.x this was easy for example with editing secure\views\createissue-start.jsp and adding a javascript that hides the element from the options list for certain users. In Jira 4.x this still works, but there are 2 new create issue places - both of which do not allow for equally easy customization. However, this could easily be improved if you added id's to the html.
The positions are:
* the Create issue in the upper right-hand corner
* the Create issue links in the project view

This is how I do it in createissue-start.jsp:

document.getElementById("issuetype100004").style.display = 'none'; 

I know of no easier/better way for doing this kind of a customization than a simple javascript that hides the option. Of course, I have added a validator that ensures this also works. The javascript is only for convenience.
fields.summary: Add html id for Jira 4.x create issue elements

fields.description:
We have have quite many custom fields available on the edit issue screen, so that scrolling is unevitable to get to the bottom of the page.

If we have to edit one the fields on the top of the page only (during regular patch planning meetings, for instance), we cannot click on _Update_ without scrolling. The "scrolling action bar" of the view issue screen should be implemented for the edit issue screen too, providing the buttons _Update_ and _Cancel_ at the bottom of the visible area.
fields.summary: Buttons "Update" and "Cancel" on the edit issue screen should be available on the bottom of the visible area
Property for enabling/disabling viewage of Jira administrators

fields.description:
Hi Atlassian,

When i search issues in JIRA i often note CPU spikes on the server, especially on a VMWare guest. I guess this is caused by the Lucence search engine. 
For this reason I wondered if indexing and searching could not be offloaded to a remote dedicated index server like Solr. Probably it would not be too difficult to use Solr instead of Lucene since Solr is a superset of Lucene regarding the search query syntax. 

Another advantage would be that one can better scale with distributed Solr servers and also one obstacle towards a clustered JIRA installation would also be taken since the the index files are not local to a JIRA server anymore.

Probably one could also address the problem that JIRA isn't available during indexing but i must confess that i currently don't know how to do that with Solr. For large installations it is really annoying to see JIRA unavailable while it is reindexing since a lot of users are affected.

What about this idea? 

Best regards,
Dieter
fields.summary: Use remote indexing engine in JIRA (e.g. Solr)
sdas

fields.description:
A versions release date is somewhat ambiguous in our organization.  Developers want to use it for "code freeze" dates but QA and business owners need to know the date that the version will be released to production.

It would be quite nice to be able to add more dates, or define custom dates.  This way the schedule for code freezes, QA and release can all be tracked.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-22085].
  {panel}

Hello,

The Description field is a default field (non-custom), and the 'View Issue' screen only allows you to control the layout of custom fields in the Details section of the 'View Issue' page.
The 'View Issue' page ignores all the non-custom fields display orders on the Screen, and JIRA was designed to show the Description system field as the last one on the Details section.
This means that, even if you set a field to show below the Description, it'll be displayed above it.

If you create two custom fields (e.g. Free Text) and set one to be displayed above and the other to be displayed below the Description field, like this:
1- Custom Field 1
2- Description
3- Custom Field 2

They'll be displayed like this:
1- Custom Field 1
2- Custom Field 2
3- Description

Please let me know if you need further explanation.

Regards,
___________________
Felipe Kraemer
Atlassian Support
fields.summary: Allow complete ordering on View Issue screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-22084].
  {panel}

The single-issue-view, footer and jira-renderer plugin module types appear to be undocumented at https://developer.atlassian.com/display/JIRADEV/JIRA+Plugin+Guide?showComments=true&showCommentArea=true#JIRAPluginGuide-JIRAPluginModuleTypes.

Just for grins, I ran a search across all the system*plugin.xml files in the JIRA 4.x source and found the following list of suspects strings. Even with false positives, I think there are fair number more plugins types to be documented!

{code}
action
actions
application-version
component-tabpanel
condition
conditions
content-link-resolver
customfield-searcher
customfield-type
description
enabled-condition
icon
issue-operation
issue-tabpanel
java-version
jira-footer
jira-renderer
jql-function
link
list-param
macro
objectdescriptor
portlet
project-roleactor
project-tabpanel
renderer-component-factory
report
search-request-view
simple-link-factory
single-issue-view
thumbnail
tooltip
top-navigation
user-format
valid-customfield-type
version-tabpanel
view
web-item
web-resource
web-section
webwork1
workflow-condition
workflow-function
workflow-validator
{code}
fields.summary: Complete the documentation of the different plugin module types

fields.description:
By rescheduling the due date of a version, that action would automatically update the past due tasks to the new release date of the version. 

So instead of having to update the version date plus all tasks past due, one should only update the version and automatically all past due tasks (bugs, etc) would get updated to the same release date as the version.

It would make the work of the team easier.
fields.summary: Allow rescheduling the due date of a version

fields.description:
Clicking on the Filter title ( Crowd Issues Recently Updated ) in the example, leads to a JQL statement:
https://studio.atlassian.com/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true&mode=hide&jqlQuery=project+%3D+JST+AND+resolution+%3D+Unresolved+ORDER+BY+updated+DESC%2C+key+DESC

!Selection_009.png!

This is counter-intuitive for users that expect it to lead to the filter so that they can edit the filter.
fields.summary: Issue Statistics gadget filter link doesn't link to the actual filter

fields.description:
Resizing the browser window or having a screen smaller resolution will cause the Road Map gadget to chop off the contents contained.

Ideally this gadget would present scroll bars when there isn't enough screen real estate
fields.summary: Scroll bars needed for Road Map gadget

fields.description: Last night we upgraded from GH 5.1 to GH 5.2. After the upgrade I noticed that the GH hour burndown chart for for our parent version was all wrong. Before the upgrade the chart looked normal. Now there is a large spike at the start and the data shown by "Excel (Chart Data)" does not seem to match the data shown in the chart. I did notice that the time remaining for Release 1.0.0 is now 16w 5h 44m but when I click on it to add a min and max is shows 4w 1d 30m, which is what is should be.
fields.summary: Parent release version has the wrong time remaining. Hour burndown chart is incorrect and it may be because of this

fields.description:
I hope this is the right place to add a feature request for the Perforce plugin for Hudson ...

Our development group uses the Perforce changelist number to identify all of our builds, documentation, releases etc.
It would be very nice to be able to see the changelist number on the Hudson project page. Right now, there seems only room for Hudson's build number. maybe you can add the changelist number to Hudson's number in some way. Maybe Hudson should have and display an additional field that could show the pchange list number.
Thanks.
fields.summary: Add ability to include Perforce change list number in the Hudson build number

fields.description:
The created vs resolved chart is a great indicator of how much work is getting done, but in our workflow (with twice-monthly average deployments) we don't resolve tickets until they pass QA.  Since we do our QA on the tail of a release, we don't see a lot of movement in these charts until the end.  This doesn't give us a very good indicator of the overall daily rate.

I propose either modifying Created v Resolved to accept arbitrary statuses or adding a new gadget/chart that allows selection of two sets of statuses.  One would represent the "created" line and the other the "resolved" line.
fields.summary: Charting arbitrary Statuses

fields.description:
For some reason the instance that I'm running is very slow.  I've gone through all of the help documents and forum posts related to optimizing the speed, but I can't seem to get anymore performance with JIRA, which is sad because it really slows me down sometimes.

It would be nice if there was a way I could quickly create multiple issues, say five or ten, where I just fill in the summary and part of the description, then I can come back later to round out the details.  This would at least allow me to quickly get the ideas out of my head and into JIRA
fields.summary: Issue Quick Entry

fields.description:
In 3.12 we could see the Link information on issues that were linked together, at the top of the sceen.
With 412 you have moved it down so that if the description is long (we have a lot of long descriptions in our issues) you have to scroll to the bottom of the screen to see if there are any links.
fields.summary: Please move the Link data above the Description field in 4.1.2

fields.description:
Occasionally JIRA takes longer than usual to shut down. The log contains

{code}
Aug 19, 2010 9:07:28 AM org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11BaseProtocol pause
INFO: Pausing Coyote HTTP/1.1 on http-8080
Aug 19, 2010 9:07:29 AM org.apache.catalina.core.StandardService stop
INFO: Stopping service Catalina
2010-08-19 09:07:30,650 ConnectionKeeper-1 INFO     [atlassian.jira.upgrade.ConnectionKeeper] Shutting down.
2010-08-19 09:07:31,040 main INFO     [atlassian.plugin.manager.DefaultPluginManager] Shutting down the plugin system
2010-08-19 09:07:55,466 main ERROR     [internal.util.concurrent.RunnableTimedExecution] Closing runnable for context OsgiBundleXmlApplicationContext(bundle=com.atlassian.jira.gadgets, config=osgibundle:/META-INF/spring/*.xml) did not finish in 10000ms; consider taking a snapshot and then shutdown the VM in case the thread still hangs
2010-08-19 09:07:58,023 main INFO     [atlassian.jira.startup.JiraStartupChecklistContextListener] Unlocking JIRA Home
log4j:ERROR LogMananger.repositorySelector was null likely due to error in class reloading, using NOPLoggerRepository.
Aug 19, 2010 9:07:58 AM org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11BaseProtocol destroy
INFO: Stopping Coyote HTTP/1.1 on http-8080
{code}


1. Why does this happen?

2. What can I do to prevent it?

3. Please can the answers to 1 and 2 be added to the documentation somewhere.
fields.summary: JIRA slow to shutdown
